resources.string: Kashi is a historical city in northern India, located in the state of Uttar Pradesh. The city is also known as Varanasi or Banaras. It is situated on the banks of the river Ganges and is considered one of the seven sacred cities in Hinduism. Kashi is also a major center of learning and culture in India, and is home to many ancient temples and universities, including the prestigious Banaras Hindu University. It is also known for the Ghats which are a series of steps leading down to the river Ganges, where Hindu pilgrims take dips in the river and perform other religious rituals. It is an ancient city, with references to it in texts from the period of the Rgveda and later. Kashi is a historical city in northern India, located in the state of Uttar Pradesh.
